text: if someone invented a keyboard that functioned even better after coffee had been poured on it I'd buy one

text: As someone who has killed a lot of keyboards with coffee before, and recently acquired a keyboard that's way too expensive for me, this comment makes me nervous :grimacing:

elements.text: As someone who has killed a lot of keyboards with coffee before, and recently acquired a keyboard that's way too expensive for me, this comment makes me nervous

text: yes after some experience it seems like keyboards and coffee are natural enemies

text: always have a pile of backup keyboards in your closet

elements.text: always have a pile of backup keyboards in your closet

text: My office pre-covid had a stack of three keyboards on a shelf that I had killed. One summer, some undergrads doing research terms were put in my office and one of them asked if they could use one of the keyboards and I had to explain my... unfortunate habit.

elements.text: My office pre-covid had a stack of three keyboards on a shelf that I had killed. One summer, some undergrads doing research terms were put in my office and one of them asked if they could use one of the keyboards and I had to explain my... unfortunate habit.

text: Sometimes submerging them in water overnight then draining and letting drying (thoroughly) will fix them.  BTW, unlike keyboards, I actually work better when I pour coffee into me. :sweat_smile:
